  390. i have been shaving using norelco electrics for 40 years, [yikes!], and they seem to last 2-4 years before i have to replace them. i have never felt it necessary to replace the blades. when my pervious razor hit the floor for the thousandth time, and i finally couldn't put humpty back together again, i had to buy a new one. this is one of those purchases that no one WANTS to buy, but when it becomes inevitable; [beard?], you break down, at really, at least, should check out reviews. the wrong razor can be a 3 year mistake, or a tough waste of money. well, i am happy to report, that after a moth of use, this one is the best one i have had EVER. i included my little history to help you see if we have had a common experience. it shaves close, very quiet, and today, after a month, i had to re charge for the first time. that's probably all you need to know. feels great in my hand, light but substantial. looks cool enough. there are cheaper ones. cheaper, in this case, is probably more expensive. more expensive ones probably have bells you don't need to ring.

  393. Using Norelco electric shavers for at least 16 years, had never bought too expensive ones. I would say that 8240 XL is a perfect shaver for this price.
  394. I bought this shaver to replace a similar, older model. This unit is extremely quiet (a whisper) compared to my other (3-4 year old) model. The heads are also different and are much smoother going over the face. This model also has a \\"pivot\\" to the head which makes movement over the face and neck more comfortable. It is also much lighter. My only complaint is that the shave is not as close as my other shaver. I find that I have to press harder and go over the face much more to get that \\"smooth\\" look, otherwise, there will still be a slight stubble look to the face. The shave also does not appear to last as long and by the end of the day the face looks a little more ragged than compared to when I shaved with the other model, which tells me it's not cutting as close. It is very easy to clean and looks very modern. The pop out trimmer on this model is also wider than my previous model which makes trimming sideburns much easier. I would give it more stars if it cut better!
  395. I have very little positive to say about this razor, but with great effort I'll try. The razor is weighty and feels like it is constructed with quality parts, and it also cleans relatively easily. Also you can use the razor while it is plugged in (very nice). Now for the negative. The motor is obviously VERY weak and slow. The razor pulls out any hairs longer than small stubble assuming it even finds the hair. As the last sentence implies the razor misses a lot of hairs and requires multiple passes. The trimmer is near useless and appears to work only when using an upward stroke at an angle (which coincidently closes the floppy trimmer). This purchase is a serious mistake and is likely only being praised by people who have not owned a really good electric razor. At this point, I have owned 3 norelco's and they were all pretty bad. I am starting to think that only foil razors are any good. The best electric razor I'vd owned is the Panasonic ES8807. I've been using it for over a year. It has a super powerful motor (13,000rpm!!) that allows for fast, virtually pain-free, shaving. And the trimmer on that razor is awesome compared to the norelco one. I use it to cut my sideburns trim around my ears...whatever. The only downside with the panasonic razor is that you cannot shave when the razor is plugged in. Cleans easily too. I just open the foil, dip the razor in water, and turn it on...and tada clean. Overall I think motor power is really important and norelco just doesn't measure up.
  396. It is a very good shaver. I like it so much. but it leads that I use it everyday.
  397. I rated it ok because there have owned other Norelco shavers in the past that were much better than this one. It arrived on time. I would not recommend the product to a friend
  398. Another great product from Norelco! I have been using Norelco Shavers for years and this is another great product from them! Performed like a champ from day one, just rinse it off when you're done!
  399. i still didn't get it.i don't know why.could you have a check and tell me why.

Says it's the best shave he's ever had. So go ahead and add it to your cart - you will be pleased.

I tried preshave balms, onlyu going slow and only goingg in one direction but no matter what i tried i'd constantly be flinching from the pulls.   426. Let me preface this by saying that I've never been a fan of electric razors. I understand the appeal, that you can get a quick shave with less mess, but they've never worked well for me. I have a very thick beard and in each case, I end up having to go back over everything with a standard razor. I decided to give the Philips Norelco 8240XL a real test and put it up against a week's growth. I know that's not a typical real-world test unless you're lazy (like me), but if it could tackle that, then I'd be sure I could recommend it to tackle day-to-day shaving.<br /><br />I'm glad to report that the 8240XL performed more than adequately. While the going was a bit slow at the get-go, the razor didn't seem to struggle cutting my beard, and with a little extra time, it took care of my beard. After subsequent uses, I've decided that it works a bit better using some kind of pre-shave lotion (or just soapy water in my case). It works well enough dry, but it's a bit better with some help. Using it for a wet shave also cuts down on the minor neck irritation that seems to accompany using it for a dry shave. The trimmer/edger gave me no problems at all and seemingly works better than my Panasonic ER389K beard trimmer for that purpose.<br /><br />I only gave it 4 stars because that despite the fact that it's the best shave I've ever had from an electric razor, it still doesn't do the job that an old-school razor blade can do (if I want a really close shave, I still have to go back over my face with my trusty Sensor). As far as electric razors go, I've never used a better one, and I plan to continue using it.
  427. I switched to using electric razors exclusively about 5 years ago due to the fact I have very sensitive skin and normal razors and shave gel irritate and cause red marks on my skin. My main problem area is the skin under my neck. Over the years I've owned about 5 different electric razors. The first was a 3 blade rotary razor very similar to this one. It was one of the worst razors I've ever used so I switched to using the alternate style electric razor which has a straight razor covered by foil guard and had avoided designs similar to the Norelco 8240xl ever since. I've spent probably $200 on different electric razors over the years and I've never been fully satisfied with them. In fact, I was looking to replace the electric razor I owned now with something new, before I was given an opportunity to review this one. The main problem I have, again, is the hair under my neck is troublesome. With my previous electric razor it would never give a clean shave under my neck and I would have to go back to using a straight razor and gel again. With my previous electric razors I never got smooth action when I would shave. It was always quite rough and I always had patches of hair left on my face when I'd already spent several minutes shaving. With the Norelco 8240XL though, I'm extremely impressed with how smooth the action is against the grain of my beard. There's no tugging or anything like that. No rough bumps but incredibly smooth and slick action that I am not used to at all using an electric razor. At first I wasn't all that impressed with how close the shave was but after using it for several days, it now shaves closer than any electric razor I've used before. It's not baby bottom smooth however, but it's smooth enough for me that you can't notice beard growth for 24 hours. I also had a bit of irritation one day after using the razor but I think this was because I was using too much pressure as I applied it to my face. This is by far the best electric razor I've used so far and I'm kicking myself that I didn't try a design like this sooner because my last Braun razor was very poor in comparison.

  431. My first one died after 3-4 years and one replacement head. Got this slight update to it and it's been very reliable. Shaves close, reasonably fast, and extremely quiet. Once a week I thoroughly clean it (as suggested) by washing and brushing the the blades and cups. Then I dry them and place them face up on kleenex and spray with lubrication.
  432. I purchased the Norelco 8240 to replace a Norelco razor that finally died after nearly 8 years of constant use. My experience has been that Norelco razors last a very long time if you take care of them. The 8240 has concentric razors in each head which increases the amount of shaving surface. This results in a quicker shave, as advertised. The Li-ion battery has very long battery life and the flip-top system makes cleaning easy. There are a handful of small regressions compared to previous generations of Norelco razors. The precision razor has a tendency to move towards the 'closed' position when shaving upwards, which is not new, but on previous models the precision razor could easily be kept in the open position while shaving upwards by placing your thumb against the switch that releases the precision razor. Unfortunately that trick doesn't work on the 8240 since the switch that releases the precision razor is mechanically different from previous models. My last complaint is that the carrying case is too small to fit the charger, unlike my last Norelco razor. These are relatively small complaints though compared to the quality of this razor.
  433. The shaver worked perfectly, as expected. The charger and cord were ackward to use, so I used the charger and coiled cord from my old shaver. No problem.
  434. It's a lot quieter and easier to clean than my old Norelco, which I must have had for 10 years. More importantly, it gives me a clean shave. What more could I ask for?
  435. I replaced my 15 year old Norelco shaver with this one. I did a lot of research and decided on this model. I am 100% satisfied with my purchase. The things that I like about it: 1. Very close shave and much faster then my old Norelco 2. Does not make a lot of noise 3. Light weight 4. Really holds a charge. I have shaved about 20 times with it on the original charge. I highly recommend this product.

  438. The last time I used an electric razor was before the fax machine was invented! All aspects of the new design and functionality have come a long way! Having said that, I have not made the leap fully. I use the device as a touch-up for the early morning before my shower. I still use a traditional wet razor with shaving cream after the shower. The electric is smoother -- less abrasive -- and more ergonomic than I remember it's predecessor to be. It also has amazing battery life, but at the end of the day, I still get a better shave with even a cheap disposable & Gillette foamy! I will keep the electric for touch ups and travel. I confess that I did not follow the instructions, which dictate a trial period of a least several weeks using only the electric system to allow the beard to adjust. Guilty as charged, but I just feel cleaner, and get a closer shave with water...... If the process is not broken, why fix it?
  439. I just purchased the shaver, and charged it overnite as required, and used it today for the first time.   440. The shaver works good. I still own the old Norelco 4604X which I still have. One thing I noticed is that the old shaver has a more powerful motor and shaves faster. The 8240XL shaves a bit smoother especially under the chin but does not have enough RPM. I would have prefer a more powerful motor, the noise is not a problem for me as I want performance. The ability to rinse the shaver heads under a hot water tap is very convenient. I like the fact that you can use the razor as a corded shaver if the battery runs out. No need to wait an hour for a recharge to use it again. A trick I discovered when using Norelco shavers over the years is that by applying baby powder to you face will prevent the heads from sticking when shaving. The powder provides a dry surface for the shaver to glide. Its a nice shaver I just prefer if it had more horsepower.
  441. I bought this model to replace my aging Norelco Quadra. The first thing I noticed was how much cleaner, faster and quieter it shaved - miles above the Quadra even with new blades. I believe this is largely due to the newer design of the shaving heads which have increased cutting areas. Also, there's a considerably deeper clippings reservoir which allows for more shaving and less emptying. But while overall it's better, it has a couple downsides. First, the single-level low charge indicator, while at least it has one, is somewhat ineffective because by the time the amber light comes on the shaver is 'already losing steam.' That's usually how I know the charge is getting low. What would help is an accompanying 'audible signal' like a simple beep. I mean, an indicator light is great but I can't see it unless I 'look at the unit.' And generally it dies before I can finish shaving, which is a real problem when running behind or in the car. Even a multi-level LED indicator would give some idea of how much charge is left, something the pricier models have. Secondly [and most annoyingly], unlike the Quadra model if I haven't shaved for a couple days it 'snags' whiskers. This can be incredibly irritating [and frustrating] depending on how bad it is [the longer the whiskers, the worse it is]. However, if I shave daily this problem is virtually non-existent. Interestingly, no matter how long I go before shaving my head it never snags [perhaps because the hair is not as thick as a whisker..?]. Some reviewers have stated that the 'SensoTouch' models don't have this problem [as their Speed XL did as well] and I may try one just to see for myself. Fortunately Norelco has a 30 day return policy which makes the decision a little easier because the upper-end shavers are not cheap [especially if you want more convenient features]. All-in-all the Speed XL is a better shaver then its predecessors, at least in my opinion. It's closer, faster and quieter. Yet the annoyances I have experienced and design shortcomings keep it from getting anything higher than 3 stars. I look forward to trying a newer model, but going to first review a lot of user feedback. For me a good shaver is more like a long term investment, especially if I'm going to spend $150 and up.
  442. This 8240 was an upgrade for me after my cheaper Norelco died. Unlike other reviewers, I guess I have the right combination of bone structure, skin and beard to make it work well for me. It charges quickly, it is nice and quiet and it takes half the time to shave as my last shaver.

  449. Having been a non-electric shaver for years now, I yearned for the simplicity of an electric razor, but worried about the problems I'd had with previous electric razors: razor burn. I'm happy to report that after nearly a month with this razor, I've had not a single instance of that, and had very close shaves as well. Maybe not as close as a blade, but close enough that I don't complain and, more importantly, my wife doesn't complain.<br /><br />This close shave appears to be due to the flexibility of the head design - all three razors display a great deal of movement, but on top of that, the entire head assembly can pivot to help keep the blades flat against difficult areas like the neck/jawline, which is where I typically suffered the most with previous electric razors.<br /><br />It's fast and quiet - just a light whirring purr as it gobbles up the stubble, and when you're done, just rinse it out under the running sink. It can't get much easier than that.<br /><br />I do, however, have to register a minor complaint, and it is that Norelco saw fit to leave out low-battery warning lights. This is cheap of them. At the price they are asking, this razor should include that. I scrambled to finish my shave the other morning when I realized that the motor was quickly dying - not realizing (having already lost my instruction booklet - PDF versions can be found on the Norelco site) that I can run the razor on the cord for a quick shave. It also would have been handy to include some kind of stand. After rinsing out the razor, it simply lays on the counter, dripping all over the place.<br /><br />All in all, however, I'm very pleased. I'm actually prepared to put away my four-bladed razor and shaving gel at this point.
  450. My husband looked at me funny when I gave him this new norelco because I'd just given him one last christmas - thought it was wasteful to use it because the other one wasn't broken or old yet.   452. Very light and easy to use. Holds charge very long time. Close, fast shave. Easy to clean under tap. Wish the charger fit in case for travel but not even needed for short trips since it holds charge so long.
  453. I had been surviving with a Remington foil shaver, and it was poor. If I didn't shave with reading glasses on, the shaver would leave hairs, which soon grew into monsters. The trimmer got more work than the foil head. Missing my old Norelco Spectra, I decided to go back to Norelco, and settled on the 8240 for the new head, that has a lot more slots. It cuts everything in sight, and its so quiet you think its getting ready to die. Plus, its so light, it feels cheap... but it isn't. The battery has memory, and is depleted by: -overcharging, so you shouldn't leave it plugged in beyond the charge. -using the 'corded' feature too much. Using it plugged in is nice, but don't rely on it. -and not letting the shaver die to the last drop, before recharging. I don't miss the 'low' indicator of the 8250's, which lights when you have about 5 minutes left. If you get stuck, you can always use the cord, or do a 'quick charge', which gives you 3 minutes of shaving for 3 minutes of charging. Enough to get you through. In any event, this battery has a long life. Unit can be rinsed, or the blades can be CAREFULLY taken apart for separate cleaning. They each have their own spot. Norelco has a good guarantee. Keep the receipt in your shaver's travel bag, just in case. But giving it 3 weeks to condition your face is good advice. Don't need higher models with stands/chargers/cleaners. Counter space is at a premium anyway, and this model travels easier. The models with cleaners get real expensive: you have to rinse the thing out every couple of weeks, and buy new cleaner every month at $5 a pop. Its a gimmick, and you don't need it. No negatives to report. Shave quality is awesome, and I can't imagine it being any better. Paid $94 at Wal-Mart, plus tax. Probably cheaper online, but who wants to wait for a good shave?
  454. Worked OK for a few months then one of the heads broke off. Kept hitting the button that opens the top when I put it in the drawer dumping shavings all over.

  459. I wouldn't say that this shaver gave a bad shave for the 3 years I had it. It was OK. But the longevity of the shaver leaves a lot to be desired. I just took it into a repair facility, since it would no longer hold a charge. They said: 1. This shaver has a tiny one cell battery, as opposed to two large cells that some other Norelco's have. 2. The battery is soldered into the circuit board. Hence, changing the battery means changing the circuit board. 3. The repair cost exceeds the value of the shaver. 4. Additionally, they diagnosed that my shaver had a \\"bad segment\\" in the motor. It wouldn't start, even though the button was on, but when the repair facility popped off the heads and just twisted one of the head drive shafts, it started running. I asked what caused a bad motor segment. The repair facility said, \\"wear, but a shaver that is only 3 years old should not have this problem.\\" Looks like Norelco has cheapened their shavers to the point that they don't last, and it is not cost effective to repair them.
  460. This was not a new shaver. The package was opened, the manual worn, the cleaning brush was missing. This is not acceptable for a personal hygene product.
  461. Battery life is excellent. Shaving daily results in a very pleasant shaving experience. Shaving every 2 days results in some pulling, but then that is my problem.
  462. I have used electric shavers all my life and have used Norelco shavers for over 10 years because I find that they give me a closer, faster, and more comfortable shave. Although my previous one was satisfactory, I decided to try the 8240XL primarily because its info said it could be cleaned under running water which would be quicker than the disassembly and brushing required with my older model. This series comes in a number of models; the 8240 is the least expensive. There are also an 8250, 8260, and 8270 series. All use the same shaving head, what you get for the extra money is more LEDs to tell you how much charge is left in the battery, and a stand. I was pleasantly suprised when I saw how much improved this was over the previous models I have used. The biggest improvement is in ths shaving head. Norelco shaving heads flex to the contours of your face or neck; this model has greater range of movement with less pressure required than previous models. The shaving comb incorporates both holes and slots (holes give closer shaves but have trouble catching longer hairs; slots catch and cut the longer hairs) so that it gives a closer, faster shave. It also has a larger chamber for holding the shaved hairs. By moving the some of charging electronics to the plug on the charger cord, they made the shaver smaller and lighter and more comfortable to use. Cleaning it every day or every few days is much easier. Just push the button to open the head, rinse it with hot water, shake the water out, and set it aside to dry. (In the previous models the head had to be remover from the shaver, disassembled, and brushed out.) The result of these improvements is that I got a closer, more comfortable shave with less time and effort than I had been getting with my older Norelco.
  463. Philips Norelco recommends using this razor for 21 straight days before deciding if it's right for you. It only took one shave to realize my Mach 3 days were over. This \\"made in Holland\\" razor is great. While it does not shave quite as closely as the Mach 3 it shaves closely enough that I feel totally comfortable walking out every morning in my suit and tie knowing my face looks clean shaven. My beard is tough, too. On my neck, especially, the whiskers go every which way and are thick. The Norelco chops them all down with no problem. On top of that, my skin is sensitive. I could count on nicking myself about one in ten times I shaved with the Mach 3. The Norelco does not nick, pinch, burn, or feel uncomfortable in any way. It even handled two days growth without causing any irritation to my skin. The lightness of the razor is a plus. Lightness here does not equate with cheapness as the razor seems solid and durable. It is also very comfortable to hold and emits only a low buzzing sound. It recharges quickly and, so far, at least, holds its charge well. Cleaning under the bathroom faucet is quick, easy, and thorough. After a little over two weeks of using this razor I am very pleased with it. I recommend it to anyone who wants to rid themselves of old fashioned blades and shaving cream. The only problem I have with the razor, and it is a slight one, is getting the area just under my nose. However, that is also a problem area with most old fashioned razors, as well.
  464. Every upgrade that Norelco makes in its electric shavers is worth the time and money and the Philips Norelco 8240XL Men's Shaving System is no exception. In the past users have gotten better grip, LED lights and a movable shaving head. With this newest generation shaver we now get a bigger shaving head surface and a head that moves in and around the shavers face. If you have never used an electric shaver before you will get a wonderful shave from this unit which is easy to use, quick to clean and keeps a long lasting charge. Norelco has long made the best electric shavers on the market and this tradition continues with this great addition!!<br /><br />***** HIGHLY RECOMMENDED

In comparing shaves I find that if I skip a day of shaving the 8240 is pulling out hair. I by no means have a Grizzly Adams type beard, but my Advantage never gave me problems like this until I skipped a full 3 days. I think it must be finer shaving surface and the fact that there is a shaving head within another shaving head. Additionally, by noon I have 5PM shadow on my chin. Never had that problem with the Advantage. The battery of the 8240 obviously lasts longer and it is very quiet, but I am really not sure this was the best razor available for me.

The 3 heads, with their contour following system and lift and cut technology really are a little powerhouse. I was able to shave quite the stubble in no time with very little effort, and subsequently with very little irritation. This was a big plus for me, as I have ultra-sensitive skin that seems to be sensitive to the slightest bit of irritation. The shave itself lasted for a reasonable amount of time when compared to my normal routine, and I have no complaints there either. The cleanup is a breeze with a quick rinse under running tap water.<br /><br />The reason that I did not rate this as 5 stars is the fact that the shaver itself is a bit awkward to store when you are done with it; it will not stand up on its own, for it's not made to. You must lay it on its side to store or to charge. I don't really like that, as it just looks a bit unkept laying around on the counter. I would like to see a stand included, or at least a base at the bottom that would allow it to stand on its own when you are done using it.<br /><br />Overall, for the price, this shaver performed better than expected, and was well worth the money spent for the price paid as it was purchased as a Gold Box Deal of the Day on Amazon! You really can't go wrong on those deals when a great one pops up!
  474. I want to make three points:<br />1. Shavers are very individual. What works on one man's face may not on another's. So quality of shave may not be completely revealed by the reviews (although other quality issues probably can). If you have used Norelco rotary shavers before to your satisfaction, you will probably like the 8200 series, especially if your former Norelco used the same head (here, the HQ9).<br />2. Almost every shaver I have ever owned seemed better than the previous one, but that is likely a new blades vs. old blades reason.<br />3. If the overwhelming number of reviews are positive then quite likely the unhappy purchasers got a bad production model. Quality control seems to be a common issue with most products.

  482. A former 40+ year blade user I switch to electric seven years ago to eliminate the early morning mess of a wet shave. The tipping point for me came when electric razors became washable. This Norelco is the best quality electric I have owned an opinion shared by many on this page. In my opinion, the triple head technology is fastly superior to the foil razor in comfort. In addition, the shave can be as close as a blade which leads me to my tip of the day. Initially, I prep my face with the Total Shaving Solution brand pre-electric solution. After several minutes of shaving, I stop to wet my face with soap and water before completing the shave. The Norelco glides effortlessly over the wet face resulting in a real close shave without irritation. Thus far, wet shaving with this electric has not harmed my razor, and I have been using this method for a solid year. Happy shaving.

It is best to shave before a shower too, in order to let the razor burn cool off!   510. This is an impressive device. Note that I've only ever used blades (Gillette Mach 3, Sensor, etc.), so I was skeptical. The Norelco 8240XL has won me over. I can shave in my free moments now, instead of setting aside 3-5 minutes for a good wet shave. It does a great job, shaving even closer than my Mach 3. There can be irritation, but I can keep it in check by applying Aveeno Intense Relief moisturizing cream immediately after shaving. If I don't, my whole face will burn and itch like crazy, but with the cream there's no problem at all. I expect this need to diminish as my skin acclimates further. Even if it doesn't, I'm fine with using moisturizer (it's probably beneficial for my skin health anyway). This is a quality product and I'm pleasantly surprised that I like it.

  524. First some background. I'm a long time electric user. I've never had a fancy electric razor. I used an inexpensive corded Remington for years before I got tired of the cord and switched to a basic cordless Norelco (model 5601X to be exact). My Norelco has worked just fine for many years. I've replaced the blades on my 5601X before, and now, I realized it wasn't shaving as close and decided that rather than replace the blades, maybe it was time to check out one of the many newer Norelcos that have come on the market since I bought mine. I chose the SpeedXL. The concept of the triple heads with multiple size screen slots sounded like it might offer an even better shave than my trusty 5601X. Well, after a month of using my SpeedXL, I have discovered, that for me, it shaved no better than my 5601X with *old blades*. In fact, I decided to go ahead and replace the blades on my 5601X, and well, I hate to say it, but for my face my old 5601X with the new blades actually does a better job. I even went so far as to shave half of my face with one and the other half with the other on two different occasions, then asked my wife which side felt smoother (without telling her of my test). One time, she couldn't tell the difference (that was before I replaced the blades on the 5601X). The other time, she picked the side I shaved with my old Norelco. So what's the moral, and what should you do? Well if like me, you had an old Norelco that uses the HQ 5 blades, you might want to consider just getting new blades rather that purchasing the SpeedXL. However, if you don't already have an HQ 5 based razor, or yours is dead (aka battery no longer charges) then this is a fine, albeit not fantastic, electric razor. That said, I'd be tempted to buy a less expensive Norelco that uses the HQ 5 blades, or consider a completely different model. Of course, all this ignores some of the extra features of the SpeedXL that may benefit you. For instance, the triple blades/screen design might work better on your stubble. Or maybe the ease of cleaning the SpeedXL appeals to you. If you value some of those other features, then this may very well be a 4-star razor for you. That's my story, hope it helps.
  525. This razor is wonderful! I bought it to replace an older model and I am not disappointed. My older razor's battery life was a week. This one is two weeks. This razor shaves the neck without creating irritation - the first razor I've had that didn't. Overall I am very impressed and highly recommend it.
  526. I just replaced an older Norelco shaver with this model and am truly impressed by how much better the shave is: it's the most blade-like shave I've gotten from an electric. Previously, I have used shavers with the HQ6 and HQ8 heads, and the HQ9 heads used in the 8240XL are substantially different and, at least for me, better; they are definitely worth trying if you have only used shavers with the older heads.

When I tap it as I'm cleaning it, I do worry that the razor head, with the cutters, moves a bit too much and I wonder if I'm damaging the hinge. So consequently, I just tap it very lightly and use the brush more as I clean it. I'll try the water cleaning option shortly. I found that the trimmer works well for my purposes - to trim hair starting to grow over my ears. I'm very pleased with the Norelco 8240XL.

  530. (I'm 18, so I've only used 4 brands and my disclaimer: I don't have a really, really thick beard)<br /><br />Before trying out the Phillips Norelco, I was using the [[ASIN:B0020MMCB6 Braun Series 3 370 Men's Shaver]] and before that, a cheap Norelco that my dad picked up at Wal-Mart; before that, God only knows what piece of junk my dad gave me to use. The Wal-Mart Norelco was bad enough, but the Braun was awful. I cut myself constantly; forget about getting a smooth shave on the neck and any area that required any special contouring was just off limits. I had so many ingrown hairs on my neck, it looked like a bad case of acne and it hurt to even try to shave, no matter how many different things I tried to put on my face to fix it. The razor clogged constantly, despite their claim that it washed clean and it never held any reasonable charge.<br /><br />Then I got this Norelco. Wow, it was like night and day. The very first shave, straight out of the box, I had no cuts, my neck was cleanly shaved for the first time since I'd been growing a beard. I had no problem in more of my usual hard to shave areas, like around my nose or under my jaw and it was so quiet. I never even had realized my other razor was so loud. I was used to grinding my old razor over my face for more than five minutes, but this took care of four days worth of growth in just a few. It's continued to do the job over and over and cleaning it up is no problem either; I'm a fan now and I'm recommending it to all my friends.<br /><br />I wish I had even more words to say how much I like this razor. My face, for once, wasn't covered with red spots, it didn't hurt and there weren't places where the razor just wouldn't cut the hairs. It may not have all the bells and whistles the more expensive models have, but for this price, this is a really great razor.

It's unfortunate, because this gives your shave a very unprofessional look, and in my line of business, that's a no-no. So, I have to run over those spots with a traditional razer.   551. Purchased mine in 2009 and it has been used at least 5 times a week, every week for the passed 5 years.<br /><br />It shaves pretty well, as long as your face is accustomed to electrics. I use a shaving lotion, like the ones from Nivea or Neutrogena, to get a closer shave. Theyre thinner than the usual shaving creams you would use with a razor, so they dont clog up your shaver.<br /><br />I make it a point to always buy shavers with a pop up trimmer. Very handy for keeping sideburns in place. This one works very well.<br /><br />I find I always have trouble getting the stubble on the base of my neck and chin, so I keep a cheapy disposable for quick clean ups. Aside from that, it does the bulk of the shaving quite nicely and quickly. Thats why I couldnt give it a full 5 stars.
  552. Great price and prompt delivery.
  553. This is money very well spend! My first one is still working after 2 or more years, just the blades do not cut as well - they cannot cut well two or more days old beard. If you do not shave under running water or under water, then you could save tons of money buying this shaver. Its head is found only in the top Philips/Norelco new models starting at $199. The new thing on these models that they are pushing is the &#34;shower&#34; shaving. With the 8240 you could still wash the shaver under the tab (I do it with hot water) and then you don't need to brush it clean as often.<br />The full model name is 8240XL – 8240 is not a “scaled down” model, I think people simply do not write the XL on the back, so you will be getting the same deal.<br />I very highly recommend it.

  556. I've owned this shaver for about 3 years now, and can say that it is a good electric shaver for the price. I do not have much experience with different electric shavers (I've used them off and on over the years), so this review is simply my thoughts about this shaver. I have no idea how it compares to others.<br /><br />Pros:<br />- Good build quality.<br />- Good close shave (good enough anyway).<br />- Can be used cordless or with the cord (if the battery is dead).<br />- Easy to clean<br />- Battery has held up very well over the last 3 years (I only charge it after it's completely dead).<br />- Blades have lasted me quite a while (I'm still using the original but it's overdue for a replacement).<br />- Replacement blades are reasonably priced and easy to find.<br /><br />Cons:<br />- The large rotary head can be uncomfortable in tight spots (my big nose gets in the way), and can be difficult to navigate around a goatee, sideburns etc...<br />- Does not do a very good job with longer hairs. (best results if you shave daily)<br />- I have a hard time with my neck area, which equates to more passes and more irritation. (I have sensitive skin).<br />- Does not have a stand, so after it's daily cleaning it lays at the edge of the sink to dry or lays on the counter top to charge and just creates more clutter.<br />- No wet shave option.<br />- Is not loaded with a bunch of fancy features like the newer high end models, but it's reflected in the price.<br /><br />Other Thoughts:<br />Despite my general satisfaction with this shaver, I have decided it's time to upgrade. I ordered a new blade for this one and will keep it as a spare and/or go back to it if I don't like my new one; but I have found myself wanting a little more. I will try a foil shaver (the Braun 790), as I believe it may be less irritating to my sensitive skin and the smaller head will be more comfortable in tight areas. I am also drawn towards the cleaning/charging base.
  557. GOOD BUYS FOR THE MONEY.<br />WILL CONTINUE DOING MY SHOPPING AT AMAZON.COM.<br />HIGHLY RECOMMENDING TO ALL OF MY FRIENDS IF THEY ARE SEARCHING FOR GIFTS.

  563. This is a very good shaver. Great value for money. I definitely recommend it. I chose it for 2 main reasons: 1. It is a Philips - I have an old Philips, now 15 years old that is still working. Great longevity. 2. It can be used while plugged in - VERY important as when the battery dies in a couple of years you can still plug the shaver in to use it for many years afterwards. NOTE: Many of the more expensive models DO NOT offer this very large advantage. >>>Consider that if you have a cordless-only shaver, that has a bulky charging station, and you want to travel, then you have to take that stupid charging station with you. Don't be fooled by the fancy pretty charging station gimmick. Pros: Excellent shave that is much improved over the old model I have. Very close to a razor-type shave. Can be used corded OR cordless. Easy to wash with hot water from the tap. Simple to use. Quiet. Cons: The only bad thing is that the pop-out trimmer is fairly rubbish. You can cut sideburns, but it is not good enough or sharp enough to carefully cut the edges and ends of sideburns very neatly.

  571. Provides a nice shave (so says my husband), but the easy open top (for cleaning)is a little too-easy-open, and it can dump the shavings everywhere. You have to put it away carefully to avoid this.
  572. Background- This is my 3rd electric in 4 years. My first was a Remington rotary R-650. That was my first try at the world of electric shavers and I was very pleased with it. I had to replace it because the battery would no longer hold a charge. But I did note that the shave I was getting was not as close as a regular straight razor would do. Of course it is obvious as to why - the bade on an electric is never actually against your face so the result cannot be the same. In trying to get a bit closer to the shave from a straight razor I tried a highly rated micro screen razor. That shave was better but at a cost. Since the foil screen is thinner than the heads on a rotary, the shave is necessarily closer. But I found there was a cost to that closeness and that was far more irritation. Indeed in the area of the upper lip I was left with redness which lasted for hours. And if the razor accidentally touched my nose, I actually wound up with an abrasion. So I continued with my older rotary which does do a better job than the micro screen on certain contours of the face) and only used the micro screen when a wanted a particularly close shave. But I needed to replace my rotary so after reading a bunch of reviews I choose this one. Other Reviews - first let me weigh into some of the negative reviews. I get about a month of shaves on a charge and I shave with a relatively heavy beard once a day. I have never suffered from this razor pulling hair nor do I have the sense that the motor is slow. It seems to run fine. But I never used it to shave anything more than a 2 day growth which only happened once. Perhaps if I waited longer to shave it might pull but it doesn't on a daily shave regimen. Also, the release mechanism DOES NOT OPEN PREMATURELY! If your razor does it is either broken or you have a very weird way of shaving. Also, I have never had the heads fall out when cleaning it. You really have to affirmatively, and with some effort, move the holding mechanism to remove the heads. Also, those complaining about having to go over your face several times, may not be used to the world of electric shaving. I have found the need to do that with all the razors I have. I even did that a bit with a straight razor. As to features - The only real negative, and it is not really a problem, is the lack of a low charge warning. But if you shave at home it really serves no purpose since you can always plug in and shave that one time with the cord. And if you shave in the car, well that is probably worse than texting - since you need 2 hands to use the razor correctly, Yes there is no shaving stand but my wife doesn't really like my razor decorating the vanity, also, it would take up more room when I travel. I see no need for it. Finally, all my razors are cleanable under water. I would never buy one which isn't. Although I would not fully immerse the razor in water, it is very washable and the design actually let's the water drip out the bottom. Also don't waste your money on cleaning solutions. I wash mine daily and once or twice a month I open and clean the heads and the individual blades (btw, make sure you replace to blades in the head they came from) anything more is unnecessary. The Shave- when I first started using this razor I was very disappointed. It did not seem to measure up to even my old single blade Remington. but they say give it time and I did and I find the 2 razors generally equivalent. But I would give the slight edge to the Norelco. The shave improved markedly when I use a pre shave lotion such as Williams Lectric shave and indeed, over time, I feel with the pre shave lotion, the result is better than my older razor of course, my older razor also has older blades). Without it the shave was disappointing. Note, I feel I have a relatively heavy beard and I require a shave every day. This razor has 3 tracks of blades and I felt just that alone should have yielded a better shave. But the inner most blade track hasvery tiny holes that a hair has to get through to impact the cutting blade. I don't see how that happens effectively, but I guess the designers have tested this and someone must think it works. The middle track has some of the same small holes and I have the same concern re that. Maybe those holes are designedf for shorter hairs and it is likely the reason I find I have to go over my face even more times than with my single blade Remington -which had longer and wider slots to permit hairs to enter. Not sure which design is more effective. My Rating - I gave it a 3 star rating for several reasons. First it does not measure up to a straight razor. So comparing the 2 finds the electric coming up short. Also, since I never tried the highly rated Braun or the top of the line Norelcos, which have different technology in the shaving heads, I felt it unfair to rate this on any higher.
  573. I really wish I had not purchased a rotary shaver and had gone for the straight line cut instead. Do I get a \\"do-over?\\" Bob
  574. I have only used Norelco razors since I started shaving over 30 years ago. I really want to give this razor 5 stars but can't. It does give you a good, close shave, if you have the time to do it. It gives a close, quality shave but the speed (RPM) of the shaver is so much slower than my old Norelco that you have to go over the area multiple times. The shave heads are very smooth and much better that my old razor. This razor is still better than a high-end Braun razor that my son bought at the same time I got this razor. I tried my son's Braun razor and it gave me the most horrible shave that I have ever had with an electric razor. It missed some many whiskers that I had to get the Norelco back out to finish the shave. Pro: Good, quality razor; excellent shave heads (smooth, not irritaing versus my old Norelco), close shave, long battery life Con: The speed of this shaver is much slower than my previous one. Takes more time to shave as you have to go over the same area several times. If this razor had a different motor (higher RPM), I feel that it would be the best razor that I have ever had.
  575. This is my third Norelco Electric Razor that I have purchased. This particular razor was purchased to replace an Norelco 8150 that I purchased 5 years ago. It dropped and the switch became intermittent. So far the 8240 meets my expectations and it did not require me to break the bank. It has all the features you would like, the lift and cut technology, floating cutters, and contour following head. The three cutting heads, with the three speed Xl system allows you to shave faster without having to make sure the cutting area is aligned with the wiskers. I would recommend it to anyone looking to purchase a Norleco Razor. Just an FYI... I still have the original Razor that I purchase 14 years ago. It also works good, just needs a need internal battery. Norleco makes a reliable product.[[ASIN:B0012TLPBQ Philips Norelco Speedxl Men's Shave Model #8240xl]]
  576. Purchased this razor with free blades for a very good price. So good in fact that I bought two. Immediately disappointed with the performance. Given the geometry of the heads they must flex to make full contact. Problem is the amount of pressure it takes to make them flex. Only way I can get this razor to perform is using one head and move it in tiny circular motions. I preferred the one head method to smashing it into and dragging it around face ,which besides being very uncomfortable is also not very effective. Anyways after 12 minutes of abuse I achieved an adequate shave and red irritated face that still stings as I type. Norelco suggests using the razor for 3 weeks before evaluating. I assume this gives your skin adequate time to toughen like leather. If you hate someone buy them this shaver. I will update this review in 3 weeks..............

  583. i am having trouble with the left side of my face shaving with this razor, the right side of my face is great but the left side i have trouble getting the stubble in the shaving heads and end up pressing too hard and getting a little irritation. i tried using lectra shave but it has way too much alcohol in it and drys my skin. overall i like the electric shaver just wish that the left side of my face would turn out as good as the right side.i had to stop using razors as i was getting bad razor burn, not so much with this razor, its worth a try, maybe if you have a tough beard you should move up and spend more money on a razor , the higher end ones got great reviews too.hope this helped.

  586. I bought this for my husband and is quite satisfied with it. Its so easy as each weekhe rinses the blades under hot water to clean. He always had a Norelco so we knew of their performance and they have even improved on that too.
  587. I'm unfamiliar with electric shavers in general: this is the first one I've ever used, so I wasn't totally sure what to expect. First off, the operation and maintenance of this device was quiet simple and self-explanatory. After an initial 12-hour charging time, it was up and running for a 2-weeks+ charge. Cleaning the blades is also easy -- a latch beneath the head pops it open and the stubble falls right out; a light rinse and the unit is clean and ready to go.<br /><br />On my first few shaves, I experienced some tugging and irritation, but I think this may be because I have a fairly thick beard, and thick, strong hair and stubble. But when I followed the instructions and pulled my skin taut, I found it easier to press the head against my skin, and to get a closer shave. I experimented with different contours and motions, and started to figure out the best way to shave with or against the grain of my face. The shave wasn't as close or as thorough as a regular safety razor, but it was good. Although I think I prefer blade I could easily see this as a backup -- while traveling or at the office on days when you're running too late to shave at home. Glad I checked it out!
  588. Using this electric shaver has been a pleasure. It quickly and easily adapts to your face, the heads seeming to instantly respond to the contours, crevices and hills that make shaving such an adventure. The shaver holds its charge for several weeks once it is properly charged. I find it necessary to recharge every 14-18 days, on average. It seems to remember the shape of your face, as shaving becomes easier over time. There were very few incidents of the shaving heads grabbing skin once I'd gotten used to applying the proper pressure. The shave is close and smooth and quite fast. I am completely satisfied with the Philips Norelco shaving system, making my return to using a regular blade extremely unlikely.
  589. So, yeah I'm not a guy so I didn't actually use this product. But my husband sure did. So I will tell you a little about him. He likes elec shavers, but his skin is so sensitive to them. He used to have to go 3-4 days without shaving because of the pain. When he finished shaving, he always looked as if someone had hit him, or burned him with something. The entire area was red. Also when I touched his face it was always prickly. He had tried numerous shavers. At least a new one every few months. It got expensive. So we tried this one. I have to say it is the best thing out there right now. He was able to use it and it didn;t leave his face red. When touched, his face is baby smooth. Definate plus! He is now able to shave every day and not have to worry about the redness and tenderness. This is well worth the money.
  590. I have been trying out new razors, getting a charge out of all the different designs that have been coming out, and have gotten a lot of experience along the way. Amongst the types I have tried are : The tri-heads with and without foaming action, the newer heads that set like they are on a platform, and a few different types of clippers. Out of all the razors I have tried I like this one the best, and the reason for that is because I (1) like the mixture of old and new, (2) like the length of the long-hair trimmer, and (3) like the way the extra pivot works on this razor. It feels like an old friend, but with a better smile.<br /><br />There are not really any downsides on the razor that are glaring to me, so I'll list the positives I have noticed. First, there is a new pivot that allows the head to move forward and backward and does not make the head stationary. That means that more ground is covered and a better shave is given. A second thing I like is that the length of the long-hair trimmer has not changed. On many of the newer models, the trimmer has been shortened. This leads to a trimmer that is harder to see, one that doesn't do as much work, and one that can break easier. So, the staying with the same build is a good thing. Next, the charge the item carries is long-lasting, making it a great tool to travel with. I have a problem with forgetting my cord, I already did that once with this model, and it did not matter. I was away for a week and still I got a good shave. And, lastly, it is does not throw too much glam t you and try to make something shiny to hide flaws in the design. As I said before, it is an old design but with some newer additions to make shaving better.<br /><br />If you want a good shave and need something new, you should try out this razor. It has been tough, has been reliable, and has been the one razor I have liked after the newness has worn away. That says a lot about something: when the newness of something becomes day-to-day, what is it, really? For this product I would have to say \\"a little over five stars in my book.\\"this product I would have to say \\"a little over five stars in my book.\\"
  591. The razor is compact, quiet during operation as compared to other razors used and quite durable. After using a couple of weeks a slight rash appeared but easily cleared up and there have been no further problems so I don't think it was the razor that caused the problem. Overall, it's a great razor.

  596. I needed to replace by Braun 7500 razor that I had been using for 5 or 6 years. After looking and all the reviews and shopping around, I decided to try a rotary razor as these were supposed to get the longer hairs and coarse hairs better than the foil types. Buying this razor was a great purchase. It is so much quieter than my old razor. It took a while to get used to the quiet but I no longer wake my wife by shaving. After about a week by skin became used to the new style of shaver. I've cut my shaving time down by half with the Norelco! With the Braun I had to go over areas multiple times to get all the difficult hairs. The Norelco seems to get everything on the first pass or too, even the coarse or longer hairs. Even when I don't shave for two or three days, it still cut close and quick. I also like rinsing the shaver under the faucet instead of the cleaning station the braun had. I no longer spend $10 every two months buying the cleaning solution and my wife appreciates not having the \\"spaceship\\" taking up room on the counter. If you are looking for a good electric razor this is one to buy. Good price, good performance, quiet operations, and easy cleanup.

  606. The Philips Norelco model 8240XL electric shaver is an excellent men's shaver considering the relatively modest price of $69.99 that I paid for it. I chose this particular model based on a very high rating given by a well-known consumer products reporting organization. It is lightweight, made of durable materials, and comfortable to hold in the hand. It provides a quick, close shave that is comparable to my old Norelco shaver that I paid $80 for six years ago. This shaver is very easy to clean. The travel pouch is almost form-fitting but does allow enough room to store the little cleaning brush that comes with the shaver. It would have been nice if the travel pouch had enough room to include the battery charger/adapter but if you are only going to be taking it on a trip of less than three weeks in duration you don't need to take the charger anyway--just make sure it nearly has a full charge before leaving. Although I've only been using this shaver for about three weeks now (since mid-Dec 2011) it has proven to be a high-quality product just as I expected from Philips Norelco.
  607. Much better than I expected. I have been using the same old, cheap electric for about 5 years. The blades were worn smooth. I started skipping shaving a day or two, or three. Tough on my neck and shirts. When to a safety razor, good shave but soon back to the two or three skip practice. I read the reviews, and got a fair price ( to me). This new razor is faster, easier on the skin, and easy to clean.
  608. It is convenient to use, and it is relatively fast. It is also easy to clean, so I like it.
  609. I purchased this shaver for my husband in 2010 for Christmas. It is now 2013 and he has used it everyday with no complaints. In addition to the three shaver things there is also a trimmer which easily pops up and back down with a simple touch. Definitely a worthwhile investment! When (or rather if?) the day comes we need to buy a new one I will definitely be looking at Philips Norelco shavers.
  610. First off let me say that although this is rated as a dry shaver that can be cleaned under water, you can actually use this as a wet shaver just fine, for me it shaves closer and more comfortable as a wet shaver. Also I just finished comparing this shaver to one of the new 3-D models, the 8240 was the better shaver for a variety of reasons...<br /><br />1. It's MUCH cheaper.<br />2. You can use this as a wet or dry shaver.<br />3. Much easier to clean where the whole head flips out vs 3 heads on the 3-D.<br />4. Bigger grip.<br />5. Cheaper replacement heads and they make a Vollco sharpener for these heads if you want to go down that road, not the 3-D heads.<br />6. The 8240 shaves AT LEAST as close and comfortable as the 3-D, if not better.<br />7. If the battery goes dead you can shave right off the power cord, you can't do that with the 3-D.<br />8. To charge the 8240 you just, well, plug it in...to charge the 3-D model you have to break out this quirky charging stand they designed and use that, a pain to travel with the charging stand as well.<br /><br />You might consider getting one of the higher end 8000 models for a few more bells and whistles.<br /><br />So there you have have...good luck

Also when emptying the razor the entire head unit separates from the base when giving it a little shake or tap to get everything out.   625. After 50 plus years of razor blades, I decided to try the Norelco speed 8240 electric shaver from Amazon. I have used it for three weeks. They are correct when they say you need to use it for 2-3 weeks to get accustomed to the way it shaves. Overall, the shaving quality is very good. It shaves close without irritation. In most areas of my face and neck I am getting a somewhat closer shave than with a blade, except in the area of my upper lip. Here I find it somewhat difficult to get as close a shave, mainly due to the size of the shaving heads and the contours of my face. Note- The use \\"Williams 'lectric shave,\\" or a similar product, prior to shaving seems to produce a much better shave.<br /><br />I like trimming attachment. I find it possible to get my sideburns cut much straighter than with a normal safety razor. It does take me longer to shave using the electric shaver. Cuts and nicks are hopefully a thing of the past. A great plus with a cordless electric razor is that you can \\"shave on the go,\\" a \\"touch-up\\" at any time without the need of a sink and water!<br /><br />Overall I am very satisfied with this product, and as a bonus, when I registered the item online they extended the warranty from two years to two and a half years.

  645. I recently received this product and am very satisfied!! We decided that I would shave my Hubby's face (he was very scared but allowed me nonetheless).<br /><br />The good points:<br />1. Unlike our older Norelco circa 2003, everything is ONE uniform piece. The other shaver had soooo many pieces to keep track of that it became cumbersome.<br /><br />2. The shaver head contours and flexes to the shape of your face and neck. Anyone who shaves regularly knows how difficult it can be to get every little hair. This system provides a clean, smooth shave.<br /><br />3. On the back of the shaver there is a button that when pressed a small tripper conveniently pops up. We used the trimmer to trim his sideburns and mustache. VERY USEFUL... opposed to looking for that little scissor.<br /><br />4. Quick charge; right out of the box only charged for one hour and we were able to shave his face. About 15-20 minutes of use.<br /><br />5. EXTREMELY EASY clean up of the head. Just push a button, the head opens and you run under the water.<br /><br />6. Also comes with a nice little brush to use pre-wash for clean-up of the excess hair. Not for your face, but for the trimmer and shaver head.<br /><br />The not so bad...<br />1. The reason it is missing a star is because I miss how my old Norelco had a little compartment for the Nivea shaving gel/lotion. The trimmer takes the place of that slot.. so it is worth it even though I miss that cream.<br /><br />Would highly recommend at a great price!! We are loving this Norelco.<br /><br />Edit to add that my husband has sensitive skin and even when he would use all those shaving creams, regular blades, quadruple blades and even my Intuition razor; this one did not cause any sort of a break out or bumps. We shaved him dry... that is great!

  691. I bought this shaver almost three years ago when Amazon put it on sale. My wife objected, she said I already had a Norelco shaver. I told her my old one was getting old, it was on its second set of heads, it was plug-in only, and besides that, I couldn't resist a bargain! So, I relegated my old one to use in our RV and bought this one.<br /><br />This has been and still is a surprisingly good shaver. I have owned quite a few electric shavers over the years, but this is the first one that has had tree rows of cutters in each head. They are quite effective. I can get a reasonably close shave in less time than any shaver I can remember and far quicker than with a safety razor. It is disarmingly quiet. You might thing it has inadequate power, but it does not slow down shaving a heavy beard or when trimming sideburns with the trimmer.<br /><br />I like the fact that it is washable. The instructions say wash the heads only but it is possible by being careful to wash away all of the cuttings without running water into the shaver. (I'm not recommending this, but it works for me.) I also like the fact that the battery charge lasts quite a while. I use it every day, but charge it once a week. I forgot one week and the charge lasted almost two weeks before it finally quit!

I bought it to replace an older one and did not realize how dull the older blades were on my old razor.It takes a 3 day growth with no issues. Since i used this type of razor before i did not have to adapt to the style so my results were immediate. Very happy so far. Money well spent.
  698. The Philips 8240 shaving system is not so strong and the battery is very weak. When I travel I have to use my old shaving system...

  709. They claim the blades last a year before they need replacement. I have serious doubts. Used it for less than 6 months and I feel it is doing a terrible job of a close shave now.   710. it has held up well and works for all beard thickness. i would definitely recommend this product to my friends
  711. i am using Phillips electric shavers every single day for more then 50 years and, in my opinion, among the Phillips line of electric shavers, Phillips Norelco XL-8240 is the best choice in terms of value for money.
  712. This XL 8240 replaces a well used Norelco 5605 whose old NiCd batteries finally gave up the ghost. I am very pleased with this new Norelco. I found it a better value This basic model does everything that the XL 8250 does, which offers mostly useless bells and whistles for quite bit more (except for the Lo-Battery light which is missing from the 8240). A MUCH better value than so many pricier models that really don't add anything significant to the use and service of this more basic model. (One feature that seems to be popular in the more expensive models is the ability wet-shave with gel if you wish, something that some people might enjoy.) The 8240 has Lithium batteries like its pricier cousins, a newly designed floating head and screens. Very quiet. Does a nice close shave. Note that the use of a 'pre-shave' like LectricShave will render an easier, closer shave with any electric razor. For those of you who've never used an electric shaver before bear in mind that your skin will need a week or so to get used to a very different technology. The shave may not be quite as close as a trusty triple razor but, if you use it regulalrly it is almost just as close (AND it will never cut you!). When I consider that you could easily spend more than $230 for a new fangled device with unnecessary accesories I am very happy with what I purchased. As it is I purchased this thru Amazon from a third party for less than $80.00.
  713. Extremely quiet shaver that gives a good, close shave. The box was missing the shaver cover, but I called Norelco and requested one be sent. About a week later, the shaver cover arrived. The Norelco customer service associate I spoke to was extremely helpful, apologized for the missing shaver cover, and said they would send one out to me. I am very satisfied with the company and the shaver itself. Would highly recommend.
  714. the razor that I ordered is what i got and seems to work good. I would recomend this razor to others
  715. I've had this razor for a couple of years and have loved it (best shave I've ever gotten from an electric). On top of the close shave it has great battery life. But I wouldn't have thought to write a recommendation here until I had a problem with it (my fault entirely). I called up Phillips and they got it fixed immediately, no fuss (thank you Mick in customer service). It is so rare to call a company these days, immediately get a human being and a human being who can immediately solve my problem. They've just made me a long time Norelco customer.
  716. Reliably good and long lasting electric shaver! There is an adjustment period of three weeks or so for the razor to orient itself to the hair growth.
